stems.BSC: (be) a state/act of maintaining a state between entities by means of a pin, (be) a pin in use, a pin being used; to utilize/make use of a pin
stems.CSV: (be) an act of utilizing/making use of a pin; use/make use of a pin
stems.OBJ: (be) what a pin is holding together

stems: (be) a state/act of maintaining a state between entities by means of a tack, (be) a tack in use, a tack being used; to utilize/make use of a tack
(be) a state/act of maintaining a state between entities by means of a staple, (be) a staple in use, a staple being used; to utilize/make use of a staple

stems.BSC: (to be) a tool, instrument, implement, piece of equipment as extension of bodily appendage(s) or sensory organs; use a tool (e.g., as per force, strength, precision, reach, pressure, instrument as labor-saving or efficiency-increasing means etc.) — [both implement and the manner/process of its function]
stems.CTE: (to be) a tool, instrument or implement; use a tool
stems.CSV: (to be) the manner/process (i.e., how it works) of using a tool or implement; to engage in the manner/process of using a tool
stems.OBJ: (to be) the party/entity using a tool or implement

stems: (to be) a tool, instrument, implement, piece of equipment as a means of “defying” the forces of Nature (e.g., as with a wheel, fulcrum, wedge, clamp, etc.); use such a tool — [both implement and the manner/process of its function]

(to be a) supply-like resource/implement/piece of equipment used by itself or in association with specific tool to maintain/sustain a constructed state (e.g., a nail, tack, hook, rivet, staple, screw, clothespin, etc.)

stems.BSC: (to be a) utensil, specialized implement for assisting in refined task

stems: (to be a) mechanical / motorized / electric / electronic implement/utensil
(to be a) supply-like resource/implement used as fuel or input for a mechanical / electrical / electronic implement/utensil

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/process of trying something out (e.g., a tool, a device, a vehicle, a machine, etc.) to see if it works/functions
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of wearing something as a trial to see if it works/functions
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of trying something out to see if it works/functions
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which is being tried out to see if it works/functions

stems: (to be) an act/process of trying something out (e.g., a tool, a device, a vehicle, a machine, etc.) to observe/learn/understand what it does or how it works/functions or whether it improves efficiency/productivity
(to be) an act/process of trying something out (e.g., a tool, a device, a vehicle, a machine, etc.) to see if one can successfully operate it, work with it, or learn to use it skillfully

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act/process of a mechanical device/apparatus/contraption functioning/operating; for a mechanical device, apparatus, or contraption to operate/function
stems.CTE: (to be) a state/act/process of a mechanical device/apparatus/contraption designed or used to do/perform/accomplish something to be in operation/functioning; for there to be such a device/apparatus/contraption functioning /operation
stems.CSV: (to be) a state/act of operating/utilizing/using a device/apparatus/contraption; to operate/use/make use of a device/apparatus/contraption
stems.OBJ: (to be) a mechanical device/apparatus/contraption itself (seen as a gestalt entity)

stems: (to be) a state/act/process of an engine/motor (whether electrical, chemically-fueled, steam-driven, wind-driven, solar-powered, nuclear-powered, etc.) to be operating/functioning
(to be) a state/act/process of a powered machine (whether electrical, chemically-fueled, steam-driven, wind-driven, solar-powered, nuclear-powered, etc.) to be operating/functioning

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/process/instance of devising something; to devise something [i.e., to bring an idea for a device or mechanical process into reality]
stems.CTE: (to be) a state/act/process of having/coming up with an idea for devising something
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical state/act of devising something based upon the idea one has for it
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which one devises (or has the idea for devising)

stems: (to be) an act/process/instance of contriving/jury-rigging; to contrive/jury-rig [i.e., to bring a simple or quickly-formed idea for a device or mechanical process into reality as a temporary or stop-gap solution]
(to be) a state/act/process of inventing; to invent something

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act/process of using a technological invention or inventions to do/perform something (i.e., accomplishing something by means of, or with the assistance of an invented machine/device or a discovered process/procedure)
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of there being a technological invention (potentially) available in order to do/perform something
stems.CSV: (to be) an act/process of using a technological invention; to use a technological invention
stems.OBJ: (to be) the specific/particular technological invention (to be) used

stems: (to be) a process/procedure based upon a biological/medical/scientific discovery or scientific research/experiments.
(to be) a state/act of doing/performing something using digital/electronic/cyber- technology (e.g., running of algorithmic programs, digitized data, interconnected/networked computers, etc.)
personal electronic computing device (e.g., PC, laptop, tablet, touchpad, etc.)
keyboard, keypad or other finger-manipulated alphanumeric interface to a computing device
mouse, pen, or other non-alphanumeric interface to a computing device
computerized, algorithmically controlled device
central processor (e.g., microchip, central gearing mechanism of a Babbage difference engine, etc.) of an algorithmic computing device
input-output interface for an algorithmic computing device
computer program, computer application, software
firmware
basic input-output instruction program for a computer, computer operating system
transistor
diode
LED

stems.BSC: (to be) an automatic computing device (i.e., an automaton per automata theory – not necessarily electronic or numerically/digitally-based); to run an automatic computational device
stems.CTE: (to be) the internal configurational state of an automaton/self-propelled computing device
stems.CSV: (to be) the process of transitioning between states/forms in an automaton; to transition between states/forms in an automaton
stems.OBJ: (to be) the input or saved memory used by an automaton to transition between states/forms

stems: (to be) a Turing machine or the lambda calculus representation thereof
(to be) a finite-state machine / finite-state automaton

refers: ALGORITHMIC COMPUTATION / PROGRAMMING / RUN A COMPUTER PROGRAM

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/process of producing a computer-implementable instruction, a “line of computer code”; to write a line of programming code
stems.CTE: (to be) a computer-implementable instruction, to be a line of programming code
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of creating/composing a line of programming code
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which a line of programming code accomplishes; what a line of computer code does/performs when implemented or run

stems: (to be) the act/process of transformation/compilation of instructions/text into a different format for a computer to execute
(to be) a state/process of computation; to implement/run a computer program

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/instance of using (i.e., listening to) radio broadcast
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of receiving/processing information learned (i.e., heard) from a radio broadcast
stems.CSV: (to be) an act/process of tuning in / finding a radio broadcast to listen to
stems.OBJ: (to be) the information heard on the radio

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/instance of broadcasting via radio
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of there being information (having been) disseminated/broadcast via radio
stems.CSV: (to be) an act/process of broadcasting information on a particular radio frequency
stems.OBJ: (to be) the information broadcast via radio

stems.CTE: (to be) a state of receiving/processing information learned (i.e., heard) on a particular radio set or receiver
stems.CSV: (to be) an act/process of tuning in / finding a radio broadcast to listen to on a particular radio set or receiver
stems.OBJ: (to be) the information heard on a particular radio set or receiver
